Argentina: Sebastian Cabot sailed up Paran√° River and built short-lived fort near modern Rosario
Belgium: Peace of Madrid temporarily ends the war between Charles V and Francis I of France, with France briefly relinquishing all claim to the County of Flanders, County of Artois, Tournai and the Tournaisis, and the Duchy of Burgundy.
England: Lord Chancellor Cardinal Thomas Wolsey ordered the burning of Lutheran books.
India: Sultan Ibrahim Lodi, of the Delhi Sultanate, angers local nobles, who respond by inviting Babur, the Mughal ruler of Kabul, to invade Delhi and Agra. The local population, plus the possession of artillery, assists Babur in killing the Sultan (whose soldiers desert him) at the Battle of Panipat.
Philippine: Spain sends another expedition under Juan Cabot to the Philippines. The Cabot Expedition also failed
Sweden: First Swedish translation of New Testament published
